clues.text: The OED uses both the R-E & E-R spelling for this word referring to a person appearing nude in a magazine
When you've stripped down, you're "wearing" this festive-sounding outfit (that really means you're nude)
"Death Becomes Her" used Catherine Bell as one of these, defined by the OED as a stand-in for nude or explicit movie scenes
Naked may be used on its own or be preceded by this 5-letter word that can mean harsh or severe
Turns out this story (& the title outfit) by Hans Christian Andersen leave both too little & too much to the imagination
4-letter word meaning to visit a discussion forum without ever posting a message
Measured in bits per second, it's the data capacity that can be transmitted over a network connection
It's the diplomatic word for the standards governing an exchange of data between computer systems
It's the 2-word term for the physical separation of a computer system from others, & a good way to protect against hacking
If you see this error number followed by "forbidden", you don't have permission to access that webpage, chump
Woody Guthrie namechecks "the New York island", "the redwood forest" & "the gulf stream waters" in this folk song
An "Acoustic Folk Years" playlist of this legend includes "A Hard Rain's A-Gonna Fall" from his "Freewheelin"' days
The song "Suite: Judy Blue Eyes" was written about the blue eyes of this Judy, a folk singer & then-girlfriend of Stephen Stills
This biblical-sounding trio had 12 Top 40 hits, including "If I Had A Hammer", subtitled "(The Hammer Song)" if you didn't get it
Pete Seeger answered this title question a few lines in--"The girls have picked them, every one"

rounds.comments: (Ken: You'll need to name the state whose two senators in the 118th Congress we have combined.)

clues.text: Casey Fetterman
Kelly Sinema
Cruz Cornyn
Ernst Grassley
Britt Tuberville
A bad start for Joseph K. in "The Trial" by this man: "One morning, without having done anything wrong, he was arrested"
Count Alexander Rostov is placed under not house but hotel arrest (across from the Kremlin) in this bestseller by Amor Towles
Time to dig up this Newbery Medal-winning tale of Stanley Yelnats' time at a correctional camp
A 1982 novella about Andy Dufresne, unjustly convicted for murder, was "Rita Hayworth &" this (but there's no "The" in the title)
John Grady Cole falls for the boss' daughter in "All the Pretty Horses" by this author, but the unhappy boss frames JGC for murder
Sarah Palin was one of the candidates to portray themselves as representing this hypothetical American who enjoys a half-dozen beers
Due to its brevity, the third Arab-Israeli military conflict is known as this
The World Series has seen dramatic game 6es, including in 2011 when this team saying goodbye to Albert Pujols beat Texas 10-9
Less famous than 66, Route 6 was once the USA's longest--3,652 miles from Long Beach, Calif. to Provincetown in this state
Soon after WWII the first production V6 engine was spearheaded by this Italian company whose name is Italian for "spear"
The French title of this 2023 courtroom drama is "Anatomie d'une chute"
These 2 words complete the title of a romance set in 18th century Brittany, "Portrait of a Lady..."
One of Edith Piaf's signature songs, it was the title of a 2007 biopic of her
This actor won an Oscar for playing silent screen idol George Valentin in 2011's "The Artist"
This director had a bit role as a snitch in his 1960 classic "Breathless"
This German name for a type of school was meant to give the idea that the tots would grow & thrive like plants
In the plain type of this, a $2 bunch of watercress costs $6; in the grade type, what was B- work earns an A-
This method that uses a "mother tongue" approach to teach kids to play musical instruments is named for a Japanese violinist
Her first book outlining her "method" was published in 1909 as "Il metodo della pedagogia scientifica"
In 1923 the college she founded in Florida merged with the Cookman Institute
At its completion a newspaper wrote, "The great continent of Africa is at length literally an island"
Woodrow Wilson tried to reshape international relations with this "numerical" 1918 program
Harappa & Mohenjo-Daro were the first cities rediscovered from this ancient civilization on the Indian subcontinent
In May 1954 this battle by a small mountain outpost near Laos effectively ended the First Indochina War
It's the rhyming, national nickname of Arminius, who defeated 3 Roman legions at the Battle of Teutoburg Forest
In a fit of rage ex-lover Don Jose stabs her to death outside a bullring after she throws away the ring he had given her
Susanna, Countess Rosina's maid, is betrothed to this valet of Count Almaviva but, of course, there are complications
In a Puccini opera this tempestuous opera singer fights to save her lover, Mario Cavaradossi, from a sadistic police chief
As this Verdi opera ends, Violetta dies of consumption with her lover Alfredo Germont at her bedside
In order to rescue her husband Florestan from prison, Leonore disguises herself as this title man & gets a job there
Staring upward is a pastime approved by Gavin Pretor-Pinney, author of these "That Look Like Things" (dolphins, Alfred Hitchcock...)
SpellTower & WordBrain are online games akin to this one with cubes & hourglass that Peggy Hill mastered
Painful memories can hamper you--beware these such as your childhood bully's cologne, APA-defined as stimuli that elicit reactions
Sorry son, missed your soccer tournament playing L4D2, this Deep South-set horror video game
Sorry son, missed your video game tournament watching Euro 2024 soccer from this city's 1936 Olympiastadion
Will Smith lived with his aunt & uncle in a posh home on St. Cloud Road in this title place
1964 saw the premieres of both "The Addams Family" & this show also named for its fiendish-sounding family
This show about the Korean War won only one Emmy as Best Comedy Series
Beginning in 1978 Bill Bixby took no shirt after getting angry on this show
A footnote to history: magician Fred Kaps followed The Beatles on his Feb. 9, 1964 show; Fred really had to make magic happen!

rounds.text: Before 1867, this city that lends its name to a type of tree was known as Novo Arkhangelsk
